fact_check_explanation_title: Primary class sizes in England and Wales
fact_check_explanation_summary: The number of infants in classes of 31 or more in Wales has increased by 18% since 2013. In England it has increased by 32% over the same time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can £300 million pay for 10,000 police officers?
fact_check_explanation_summary: £300 million would cover those officers’ salaries for one year, but it wouldn’t cover the costs of training, equipment, and overheads at the same time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Has the SNP ever been fined for election spending mistakes?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Electoral Commission told us it has never issued the Scottish National Party with any kind of fine or sanction.

fact_check_explanation_title: When was the four-hour A&E target last hit?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The four hour A&E target hasn’t been met in England since July 2015, and the last time it was met over a full year was in 2013/14. The target hasn't …

fact_check_explanation_title: If politicians talk about the rich, always ask who they mean
fact_check_explanation_summary: What does "rich" actually mean? And how rich is "rich"? There are wealthy individuals with low incomes, and there are high-income people who have accumulated little wealth.

fact_check_explanation_title: Democratic deficit? The rules on election spending
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservative Party has been under investigation by the Electoral Commission, the police and the Crown Prosecution Service over election spending. Why?

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour party confidence in Jeremy Corbyn
fact_check_explanation_summary: In June 2016 three quarters of Labour MPs in the House of Commons supported a vote of no confidence in Mr Corbyn. He was re-elected as Labour leader by the …

fact_check_explanation_title: How much more is the NHS spending on private providers?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The proportion of NHS spending going to private providers is growing year on year.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are there one million older people unable to look after themselves?
fact_check_explanation_summary: There were 1.2 million over 65s who experienced difficulty with basic tasks such as eating and washing, according to Age UK.
The Conservatives have introduced a two-child cap on Child Tax Credit, which includes an exception for conception during non-consensual sex or sex in an abusive relationship.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are there one million people in hospital with nowhere else to go?
fact_check_explanation_summary: In January there were 7,100 people in hospital at the end of the month who were medically fit to leave but weren't discharged. Across the whole month there were 197,000 …

fact_check_explanation_title: Why local elections are not useful indicators of national votes
fact_check_explanation_summary: Polling expert Anthony Wells cautions against reading too much into the local election results, ahead of the general election in June.
